parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field RS.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: While this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or the EDC system. This field can be included into the database or populated during SDTM-based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: STUDYID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field RS.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically preprinted in the header of each CRF page for single site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be preprinted on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. EDC: This should be prepopulated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SITEID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field RS.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTM Implementation Guide.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: SUBJID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field RS.VISIT

fields.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
fields.implementationNotes: This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is represented only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to SDTM Table 2.2.4.
fields.label: Visit Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: VISIT

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field RS.VISDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using DD-MON-YYYY format.
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: If the date the tests were collected can be determined from the Visit Date variable (VISDAT), apply that date to all of the tests at that visit, or the collection date can be collected on the CRF using the date (RSDAT). In this domain, it may not be appropriate to use the visit date as RSDTC.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. If the date of a measurement, test, observation can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM), concatenate the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populate the SDTMIG variable RSDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C118971
Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C124298

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field RS.RSCAT

self.title: Category for Response or Clin Class

fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: This is most commonly either a heading or a preprinted category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response is typically a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header. There are separate codelists used for categorizations of records about oncology response criteria (ONCRCAT) or other clinical classification (CRSCAT). Collect if multiple clinical classifications, or disease responses are active in a single study/database; otherwise, information should be distinguished somewhere on a form (e.g., table name, title, tab).
fields.label: Category for Response or Clin Class
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: RSCAT
fields.questionText: What is the [category/ criteria] for the [disease response/clinical classification] or What is the [response/clinical classification] criteria?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field RS.RSSCAT

self.title: Subcategory for Response or Clin Class

fields.definition: A sub-division of the RSCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be preprinted on the CRF or screen and prepopulated in the data management system. This is not typically a question to which the site would provide an answer. RSSCAT can only be used if there is an RSCAT and it must be a subcategorization of RSCAT.
fields.label: Subcategory for Response or Clin Class
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: RSSCAT
fields.questionText: What is the sub -category for the [disease response/clinical classification]?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field RS.RSPERF

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate whether or not the [disease response/clinical classification] assessment was performed.
fields.definition: An indication whether or not a planned disease response or clinical classification assessment was performed.
fields.implementationNotes: A Not Done check box, which indicates the test was "NOT DONE". Typically, there would be one check box for each measurement. This field can be useful to confirm that a blank result field is meant to be blank.
fields.label: Response or Clin Class Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTMIG variable RSSTAT. If RSPERF="N", the value of RSSTAT will be "NOT DONE". If RSPERF="Y", RSSTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables ( e.g., RSCAT and RSSCAT, RSTPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable RSTESTCD would be populated as RSALL and an appropriate test name (RSTEST) provided. See SDTMIG v3.2 Section 4.1.5.1.2.
fields.name: RSPERF
fields.questionText: Was the [(disease) response/clinical classification] assessment performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field RS.RSREASND

self.title: Response or Clin Class Reason Not Done

fields.completionInstructions: If the response was not collected, indicate why.
fields.definition: An explanation of why the data are not available.
fields.implementationNotes: The reason the data are not available may be chosen from a sponsor defined list (e.g., Not Imaged, Patient Refusal, Site Error) or entered as free text. When RSREASND is used, the SDTMIG variable RSSTAT should also be populated in the SDTM-based dataset.
fields.label: Response or Clin Class Reason Not Done
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: RSREASND
fields.questionText: Why was the [disease response/clinical classification] assessment not performed?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78735

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field RS.RSEVAL

fields.definition: The role of the person who provided the information.
fields.implementationNotes: Used only for results that are subjective (assigned by a person or a group). RSEVAL is expected for oncology response criteria. It can be null when the investigator provides all the data in a study. It should contain no null values when data from 1 of more evaluator are used in a study.
fields.label: Response or Clin Class Evaluator
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: RSEVAL
fields.questionText: What was the role of the person performing the [disease response/clinical classifiaction] assessment?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96777

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field RS.RSEVALID

self.title: Response or Clin Class Evaluator ID

fields.completionInstructions: Identify the evaluator providing this evaluation.
fields.definition: Used to distinguish multiple evaluators with the same role.
fields.implementationNotes: When multiple assessors play the role identified in RSEVAL, values of RSEVALID will attribute a row of data to a particular assessor.
fields.label: Response or Clin Class Evaluator ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: RSEVALID

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field RS.RSLNKID

self.title: Response or Clin Class Link ID

fields.completionInstructions: If collected, record the unique [Disease Response or Clinical Classification ] Link ID Identifier.
fields.definition: An identifier used to link the disease response assessment to the related record in another domain which was used to determine the response result.
fields.implementationNotes: This variable is used to provide a unique code in order to link records across related CRFs (e.g., RS and TR) when appropriate. Sponsors develop their own conventions for populating RSLNKID.
fields.label: Response or Clin Class Link ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: RSLNKID
fields.questionText: What was the [Disease Response or Clinical Classification ]Link ID Identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field RS.RSLNKGRP

self.title: Response or Clin Class Link Group

fields.completionInstructions: If collected, record the unique [Disease Response or Clinical Classification ] Link Group Identifier.
fields.definition: A grouping identifier used to link the disease response assessment to a group of related record in another domain which was used to determine the response result.
fields.implementationNotes: This variable is used to provide a unique code in order to link a group of records across related CRFs (e.g., RS and TR) when appropriate. Sponsors develop their own conventions for populating RSLNKGRP.
fields.label: Response or Clin Class Link Group
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: RSLNKGRP
fields.questionText: What was the [Disease Response or Clinical Classification] Link Group Identifier?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C96781

implements.title: Name of Measurement, Test or Examination

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field RS.RSTEST

self.title: Response or Clin Class Assessment Name

fields.completionInstructions: Record the name of the RS test, if not preprinted on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: Descriptive name of the disease response or clinical classification used to obtain the measurement or finding.
fields.implementationNotes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be preprinted on the CRF rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Response or Clin Class Assessment Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target. The SDTMIG variable RSTESTCD may be determined from the value collected in RSTEST. The SDTMIG variables RSTESTCD and RSTEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
fields.name: RSTEST
fields.questionText: What was the [disease response/clinical classification] test name?

implements.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field RS.RSORRES

self.title: Response or Clin Class Original Result

fields.definition: Result of the disease response or clinical classification as originally received, collected,or calculated.
fields.implementationNotes: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.
fields.label: Response or Clin Class Original Result
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: RSORRES

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for field RS.RSORRESU

self.title: Response or Clin Class Original Units

fields.completionInstructions: Record or select the original units in which these data were collected, if not preprinted on CRF
fields.definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: Should be preprinted on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a field that requires the site to enter text. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere.
fields.label: Response or Clin Class Original Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the column with the heading SDTMIG Target.
fields.name: RSORRESU
fields.questionText: What was the [disease response/clinical classification] unit?
